Question: When does a person who purchases a dwelling on or after the commencement of these Regulations cease to qualify as a “relevant owner” for the scheme?

Passages.Passage:
(2) Where a person purchases a dwelling on or after the date of the coming 
into operation of these Regulations, he or she shall not be a relevant owner for 

 
 
 
 [25] 7 

the purposes of these Regulations where he or she knew, or ought to have 
known, that defective concrete blocks were used in the construction of the 
dwelling.

Question: If an eligible applicant later receives a payment outside this scheme for the same damage, what are their notification and repayment obligations to the local authority?

Passages.Passage:
11. (1) Without prejudice to the generality of Regulations 8(2)(h), 9(2)(m) 
and 10(2)(e), where, in relation to a relevant dwelling in respect of which a 
confirmation of grant approval has been issued under Regulation 9 or in respect 
of which a payment has been made to an individual under these Regulations, a 
payment otherwise than under these Regulations is made to or for the benefit of 
the eligible applicant or individual concerned, as the case may be, in respect of 
damage to the dwelling arising out of or in connection with the use of defective 
concrete blocks in its construction, that eligible applicant or individual, as the 
case may be, shall give notice in writing to the relevant local authority of the 
payment and the amount thereof within 28 days of the making of that payment. 

(2) On receipt of a notice under paragraph (1), where a payment has 
previously been made under these Regulations to the eligible applicant or 
individual concerned, as the case may be, the relevant local authority shall give 
notice in writing to the eligible applicant or individual concerned, as the case 
may be, of the total amount paid under these Regulations to the eligible 
applicant or individual, as the case may be. 

(3) On receipt of the notice under paragraph (2), the eligible applicant or 
individual concerned, as the case may be, shall be immediately liable to pay to 
the relevant local authority the lesser of the following amounts: 

(a) 

the amount equal to the payment or payments made under these 
Regulations as set out in the notice referred to in paragraph (2), 
or 

(b) 

the amount equal to the payment referred to in paragraph (1).

Question: Under what circumstances is an applicable person permitted to leave their place of residence during the operation of these Regulations?

Passages.Passage:
4. (1) An applicable person shall not leave his or her place of residence without reasonable excuse.

(2) Without prejudice to the generality of what constitutes a reasonable excuse for the purposes of paragraph (1), such reasonable excuse includes an applicable person leaving his or her place of residence (in this paragraph referred to as the “relevant residence”) to -

(a) provide, or assist in the provision of, an essential service, whether for remuneration or not,
(b) go to an essential retail outlet for the purpose of obtaining items (including food, beverages, fuel, medicinal products, medical devices or appliances, other medical or health supplies or products, essential items for the health and welfare of animals, or supplies for the essential upkeep and functioning of the relevant residence), or accessing services provided in the outlet, for the applicable person or any other person residing in the relevant residence,
(c) obtain money for the applicable person or a vulnerable person,
(d) attend a medical appointment or accompany another person to such an appointment,
(e) exercise, either alone or with other persons residing in the relevant residence, within a 2 kilometre radius of that residence,
(f) attend to vital family matters, funerals, fulfil legal obligations, or provide emergency assistance.

Question: What conditions must be met for an event to be lawfully held within a relevant geographical area under these Covid-19 Regulations?

Passages.Passage:
5. (1) A person shall not -
(a) hold an event in a relevant geographical area unless -
(i) the event is a relevant event, and
the number of participants in the event is limited to not more than is reasonably necessary having regard to the nature of the purposes for which the event is held,
or
(b) participate in an event in a relevant geographical area unless -
(i) the event is a relevant event, and
(ii) the person is a relevant participant.

(3) In this Regulation -
“relevant event” means an event held for the purposes of any matter which falls within any subparagraph of Regulation 4(2);
“relevant participant”, in relation to a relevant event, means a person who participates in the event in order to engage in any activity required to be undertaken for the purposes for which the event is held.

Question: What legal change did these Regulations introduce regarding the duration of the Covid-19 restrictions under the Health Act 1947?

Passages.Passage: 2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 121 of 2020) is amended by the substitution of “the 5th day of May 2020” for “the 12th day of April 2020”.

Question: According to the Explanatory Note, what is the substantive effect of S.I. No. 128 of 2020 on the operation period of the Covid-19 Temporary Restrictions Regulations?

Passages.Passage: These Regulations amend the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A-Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 121 of 2020) to provide that the Regulations shall remain in operation until 5 May 2020.

Question: How did S.I. No. 160 of 2020 update the definition of “Directive” under the European Communities (Vegetable Seeds) Regulations 2001?

Passages.Passage: 2. The European Communities (Vegetable Seeds) Regulations 2001 (S.I. No. 306 of 2001) are amended by substituting in Regulation 2(1) for the definition of “Directive” (as amended by the European Communities (Vegetable Seeds) (Amendment) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 58 of 2020)) the following: “‘Directive’ means Council Directive 2002/55/EC of 13 June 2002, Council Directive 2003/61/EC of 18 June 2003, Regulation (EC) No 1829/2003 … Commission Implementing Directive (EU) 2020/432 of 23 March 2020”.

Question: What was the legislative intent of S.I. No. 160 of 2020 as described in its Explanatory Note?

Passages.Passage: These Regulations give effect to the provisions of Commission Implementing Directive (EU) 2020/432 as they apply to Council Directive 2002/55/EC on the marketing of vegetable seeds by updating the listing of scientific names of species contained.

Question: What additional EU Directive was incorporated into the definition of “Directive” in Regulation 2(1) of the European Communities (Vegetable Seeds) Regulations 2001 by S.I. No. 202 of 2020?

Passages.Passage: 2. The European Communities (Vegetable Seeds) Regulations 2001 (S.I. No. 306 of 2001) are amended by substituting in Regulation 2(1) for the definition of “Directive” (as amended by the European Communities (Vegetable Seeds) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 160 of 2020)) the following: … Commission Implementing Directive (EU) 2020/177 of 11 February 2020.

Question: According to the Explanatory Note of S.I. No. 202 of 2020, what specific phytosanitary measures do these Regulations implement regarding vegetable seeds?

Passages.Passage: These Regulations give effect to the provisions of Commission Implementing Directive (EU) 2020/177 by amending the Annexes I and II to Directive 2002/55/EC as they relate to inspections for Union regulated non-quarantine pests (RNQPs) and measures intended to prevent their presence on vegetable seeds for planting.

Question: How are the ranks within the Garda Síochána structured and limited under these Regulations?

Passages.Passage:
2. (1) The members of the Garda Síochána, other than reserve members, are to be divided into the ranks specified in column (1) of the Schedule.

(2) The maximum number of members in each rank specified in column (1) of the Schedule is that specified in column (2) of that Schedule opposite the mention of the rank in column (1).

Question: What previous Regulations governing Garda Síochána ranks were revoked by these 2020 Regulations?

Passages.Passage: 3. The Garda Síochána (Ranks)(No. 2) Regulations 2009 (S.I. No. 390 of 2009) are revoked.

Question: Under these Regulations, what constitutes an offence in relation to the Council Regulation concerning ISIL (Da’esh) and Al-Qaeda?

Passages.Passage:
3. (1) A person who contravenes a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 1 of Schedule 2 shall be guilty of an offence.

(2) A person who contravenes a condition of an authorisation granted under a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 2 of Schedule 2 shall be guilty of an offence.

Question: What enforcement powers and penalties are provided to competent authorities under these Regulations for ensuring compliance with EU restrictive measures?

Passages.Passage:
These Regulations provide for the enforcement of restrictive measures contained in Council Regulation (EU) 2016/1686 of 20 September 2016 as amended, regarding restrictive measures concerning ISIL (Da'esh) and Al-Qaeda.

The Regulations provide that competent authorities of the State may issue directions for the purpose of giving full effect to the sanctions. The Regulations create offences for breach of the Council Regulations or for failure to comply with the directions of competent authorities of the State with regard to implementation of the sanctions and provides for appropriate penalties.

Question: For the purposes of section 17 of the Road Traffic Act 2010, what does the prescribed certificate set out in Part 2 of Schedule 2 certify?

Passages.Passage:
“5. The form set out in Part 2 of Schedule 2 is the prescribed form of certificate for the purposes of section 17 of the Act of 2010 to certify-

(a) the presence of a drug or drugs, and
(b) the concentration of a drug or drugs.”

Question: Under section 17, which body issues the certificate and what does the certificate state about the analysed specimen?

Passages.Passage:
The Medical Bureau of Road Safety certifies that on analysis by the Bureau the specimen to which the above particulars relate contained ...

This certificate is issued under section 17 of the Road Traffic Act, 2010.

Question: Under these Regulations implementing restrictive measures against cyber-attacks, what conduct constitutes an offence?

Passages.Passage:
3. (1) A person who contravenes a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 1 of the Schedule 2 shall be guilty of an offence.

(2) A person who contravenes a condition of an authorisation granted under a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 2 of the Schedule 2 shall be guilty of an offence.

Question: What penalties apply on summary conviction and on conviction on indictment for an offence under Regulation 3?

Passages.Passage:
4. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable -

(a) on summary conviction, to a class A fine or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 months or both, or

(b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000 or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or both.

Question: What procedures must the Sea-Fisheries Protection Authority follow when an official detects a serious infringement by an Irish or foreign fishing vessel?

Passages.Passage: 6. (1) Where an Official detects an alleged serious infringement— (a) involving an Irish sea-fishing boat, wherever the boat may be, or (b) involving a foreign fishing vessel, in the exclusive fishery limits of the State (within the meaning of section 88 of the Act of 2006) he or she shall prepare a report and forward it to the SFPA. (2) The SFPA shall send the report and any material collected to the Determination Panel to determine if a serious infringement has occurred. (3) A report prepared and any material collected by an Official in the exercise of his or her powers and any submission referred to in paragraph (5) may be used by the Determination Panel in determining whether a serious infringement has occurred for which points should be proposed under these Regulations. (4) The SFPA shall, at the same time as it sends the material referred to in paragraph (2) to the Determination Panel, provide the licence holder with a copy of the material. (5) The licence holder shall be given the opportunity to make submissions in writing to the Determination Panel within 30 working days from the date of the notification.

Question: Under what circumstances can the Appeals Officer confirm that points should be assigned to a licence holder for a serious infringement?

Passages.Passage: 12. (10) The Appeals Officer shall confirm that the points shall be assigned to the holder of the licence where on the balance of probabilities, he or she considers that the alleged serious infringement in respect of which it is proposed to assign points — (a) did occur, (b) occurred after the commencement of these Regulations, (c) involved an infringement that was serious, and (d) did involve the fishing vessel concerned.

Question: Under what conditions may a person lawfully carry out an act that would otherwise contravene the Council Regulation concerning restrictive measures on Iran?

Passages.Passage: 5. Notwithstanding Regulation 3, a person who has received an authorisation under a provision of the Council Regulation specified in Part 2 of Schedule 2 may, subject to compliance with the terms and conditions of such authorisation, do such of the things as are so authorised.

Question: What penalties apply to persons who commit offences under Regulation 3 of the European Union (Restrictive Measures concerning Iran) (No. 2) Regulations 2020?

Passages.Passage:
4. A person who is guilty of an offence under Regulation 3 shall be liable -
(a) on summary conviction, to a class A fine or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 12 months or to both, or
(b) on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding €500,000 or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding 3 years or to both.

Question: What specific amendment does the Forestry (Amendment) (No. 3) Regulations 2020 make to Regulation 21(3) of the Forestry Regulations 2017?

Passages.Passage: 2. The Forestry Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 191 of 2017) are amended in Regulation 21(3) by substituting “to the public, for purchase at a fee not exceeding the reasonable cost of doing so,” for “to the public”.

Question: From what date did the Forestry (Amendment) (No. 3) Regulations 2020 come into operation?

Passages.Passage:
GIVEN under my Official Seal, 7 October, 2020.
CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE,
Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine.

Question: Which functions and associated administrative responsibilities were transferred from the Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection to the Minister for Business, Enterprise and Innovation under this Order?

Passages.Passage:
3. (1) The functions vested in the Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection-
(a) by or under the Acts specified in Part 1 of the Schedule and the provisions of the Acts specified in Part 2 of the Schedule, and
(b) under the Regulations specified in Part 3 of the Schedule,
are transferred to the Minister for Business, Enterprise and Innovation.

Question: What legal effect does Regulation 4 provide for ongoing legal proceedings involving the former Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection after the transfer of functions?

Passages.Passage: 4. Where, immediately before the commencement of this Order, any legal proceedings are pending to which the Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection is a party and the proceedings have reference to functions transferred by this Order to the Minister for Business, Enterprise and Innovation, the name of the Minister for Business, Enterprise and Innovation shall, in so far as the proceedings relate to any function transferred by this Order, be substituted in the proceedings for that of the Minister for Employment Affairs and Social Protection or added in the proceedings, as may be appropriate, and the proceedings shall not abate by reason of such substitution or addition.

Question: What qualifications are newly prescribed under these Regulations for the purpose of registration on the Quantity Surveyors’ Register?

Passages.Passage:
SCHEDULE
PRESCRIBED QUALIFICATIONS
The following qualifications are prescribed pursuant to section 29(2)(a)(iii) of the Building Control Act 2007:
(i) Bachelor of Science (BSc (Honours) in Quantity Surveying) awarded by Cork Institute of Technology.
(ii) Bachelor of Science (BSc (Honours) Construction Economics and Quantity Surveying) awarded by Galway – Mayo Institute of Technology.
(iii) Bachelor of Science (BSc (Honours) in Quantity Surveying) awarded by Letterkenny Institute of Technology.
(iv) Bachelor of Science (BSc (Honours) in Quantity Surveying) awarded by Institute of Technology, Sligo.
(v) Bachelor of Science (BSc (Honours) in Quantity Surveying) awarded by Waterford Institute of Technology.
(vi) Bachelor of Science (BSc (Honours) in Quantity Surveying) awarded by Institute of Technology, Carlow.
(vii) Master of Science (MSc in Quantity Surveying) awarded by Technological University Dublin.
(viii) Master of Science (MSc in Quantity Surveying) awarded by Limerick Institute of Technology.

Question: What authority does section 29 of the Building Control Act 2007 give the Minister regarding prescribed qualifications under these Regulations?

Passages.Passage: Section 29 of the Building Control Act 2007 provides that the Minister may prescribe additional qualifications and educational bodies to those recognised in the Act as being suitable for the purpose of the registration of certain persons on the register of Quantity Surveyors established under Part 4 of the Building Control Act 2007.

Question: What entity is designated for the purposes of section 29 of the Civil Law and Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020?

Passages.Passage: 2. The Judicial Council is designated for the purposes of section 29 of the Civil Law and Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (No. 13 of 2020).

Question: On what date did the Civil Law and Criminal Law (Miscellaneous Provisions) Act 2020 (Section 29) (Judicial Council) (Designation) Order 2020 come into operation?

Passages.Passage: (2) This Order comes into operation on the 31st day of October 2020.

Question: Under these amended District Court Rules, how must applications for an order under section 34(6) or 39(4) of the Criminal Justice (Forensic Evidence and DNA Database System) Act 2014 be made?

Passages.Passage: These rules amend Order 31 and Order 37 of the District Court Rules and amend certain existing forms to provide that applications for an order under section 34(6) and 39(4) of the Criminal Justice (Forensic Evidence and DNA Database System) Act 2014 and under 79A(5) and 79A(16) of the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) Act 2008 as amended, are made by information on oath and in writing.

Question: According to Regulation 10, what specific factual details must an information sworn under section 16(1) of the Criminal Justice (Forensic Evidence and DNA Database System) Act 2014 contain?

Passages.Passage: 10. (1) An information sworn for the purposes of section 16(1) of the Act of 2014 shall include details of (as the case may be): (i) the facts grounding the matters mentioned in section 16(4)(a) to (d) of the Act of 2014; (ii) the facts which establish that one of the conditions specified in section 16(1) of the Act of 2014 is satisfied, and (iii) the means by which and time at which, the protected person concerned and any parent or guardian of that person (other than a parent or guardian to whom section 15(2) of the Act of 2014 applies), was informed in accordance with section 16(2) of the Act of 2014 of the intention to make the application (including the time and place at which it was intended to make the application), and (iv) the rank of the applicant.

Question: What specific extension to the operation period do these Regulations provide for the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Face Coverings in Certain Premises and Businesses) Regulations 2020?

Passages.Passage: These Regulations extend the operation of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Face Coverings in Certain Premises and Businesses) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 296 of 2020) until 09 June 2021.

Question: Which provision in Regulation 2 formalizes the extended expiry date for the Covid-19 Face Coverings Regulations, and what date replaces the previous termination date?

Passages.Passage: 2. Regulation 2 of the Health Act 1947 (Section 31A – Temporary Restrictions) (Covid-19) (Face Coverings in Certain Premises and Businesses) Regulations 2020 (S.I. No. 296 of 2020) is amended by the substitution of “the 9th day of June 2021” for “the 9th day of November 2020”.

Question: Under what circumstances are recipients of social welfare payments entitled to a 100% bonus under the Social Welfare (Temporary Provisions) Regulations 2020?

Passages.Passage: 3. (1) This article applies to a person who is, or becomes, entitled to— (a) a payment specified in article 4 of these Regulations in respect of the relevant week, or (b) domiciliary care allowance in respect of the period commencing on 1 December 2020 and expiring on 31 December 2020. (2) In the case of a person to whom sub-article (1)(a) of this article applies, the amount of any such payment specified in article 4 of these Regulations (including any increase in that payment) payable to that person in respect of the relevant week shall be increased by 100 per cent.

Question: According to the Explanatory Note, what is the minimum amount payable for the December 2020 social welfare bonus, and which categories of payments qualify?

Passages.Passage: These Regulations provide for the payment of a bonus to recipients of social welfare payments and to recipients of domiciliary care allowance during the month of December 2020. The amount of the bonus in the case of recipients of social welfare payments is 100% of the normal weekly payment payable during the first week in December 2020, subject to a minimum payment of €20.

Question: What is the new deadline for the cessation of waste burning activities permitted under the Waste Management (Prohibition of Waste Disposal by Burning) Regulations?

Passages.Passage: 6. The burning of waste in compliance with Regulation 5(1) (a) and 5(1) (b) shall cease on 1 January 2022.

Question: For what purpose do the 2020 Amendment Regulations extend the exemption under the Waste Management (Prohibition of Waste Disposal by Burning) Regulations 2009?

Passages.Passage: The purpose of these regulations is to extend until 1 January 2022 an exemption provided for under the Waste Management (Prohibition of Waste Disposal by Burning) Regulations 2009 (S.I. 286 of 2009) which exists to allow farmers, in accordance with the waste hierarchy and as a last resort, to dispose of wastes generated by agricultural practices.

Question: According to Regulation 2, who are the individuals appointed as Special Advisers to the Tánaiste and Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment, and when did their appointments take effect?

Passages.Passage: 2. The persons mentioned in the Schedule, particulars of whose addresses have been deposited at the offices of the Department of the Taoiseach, are appointed to be Special Advisers to the Tánaiste and Minister for Enterprise, Trade and Employment with effect from 27 June 2020.

Question: Who formally approved the appointments of the Special Advisers listed in the Schedule, and on what date was the Order given under the Government’s seal?

Passages.Passage: SCHEDULE Brian Murphy Angela Flanagan Philip O’Callaghan Clare Mungovan GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Government, 22 December, 2020. MICHEÁL MARTIN, Taoiseach.
